title: Authority To Order the Ready Reserve of the Armed Forces to Active Duty To Address International Drug Trafficking

enrichment.summary: This executive order authorizes the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Homeland Security to activate units and individual members of the Ready Reserve to help address the national emergency related to international drug trafficking. It enables military reservists to be ordered to active duty under existing legal authorities to support efforts combating global illicit drug trade threats.
potential_concerns: Activation of reservists may disrupt civilian employment and personal lives of service members called to active duty.
Increased military involvement could lead to mission creep in drug interdiction efforts, potentially raising civil-military boundary concerns.
There may be legal or logistical challenges in coordinating activation authority across different military branches and Homeland Security components.
Use of military resources in a law enforcement context could raise concerns about militarization of drug policy enforcement.
Budget constraints or delayed appropriations could limit effective implementation of activation and readiness efforts.
